div.l: For al his kepyng and his Ielousie
And Absolon̄ hath kyst her nethir eye
And Nycholas / is skalded / on his towt
This tale is done / and god save al this rowt
Explicit Fabula Molendinarii

⁊etAn unusual character appears in the incipits of Ad1 through about f. 260, where a different hand begins to execute the rubrics. On 88v, it appears as "+" and on 262v (new hand) as "et." Agreed with PR that it might best be trancribed as abbreviating "et" throughout. Incipit prologus de le Reeve
Whanne folke have lawhen / at this nyce caas
Of Absolon / and hende Nycholas
Dyvers folke / diủersly seid thei seide seid thei seide Assuming that the scribe originally omitted "thei." It is also possible that "thei seid" was originally transposed.
But for the more part / thei lowh and pleyde
Ne at his tale / I sawe no man him greve
But it wer͗e only Osewolde the reeve
Bi cause he was / of carpinters craft
A lytel Ire / in his hert is laft
He gan to gruche / and blamed it a lyte
Sytheek ꝙquod he / ful wel cowde I him quyte
Wyth bleryng / of a prowde myllers eye
Yef that me lyst / to speke of rybawdye
But y am olde / me list nat pleye for age
Gras tyme is don̄ / my fodir is forage
This whit top wryteth myn owne yeris
Myn hert is also mowled as myn heris
But yit I fare as doth an opyn̄ ars
That ilke spite / is ever lenger the wers
